overview_of_class: The Arab Spring of 2010-2011 was an optimistic time of rapid and unexpected change that has had far reaching consequences. Its reverberations continue to be felt in the multiple civil wars in the Middle East as well as the hopeful signs of transformation in Tunisia. This course will look closely at the causes and outcomes of the Arab Spring from 2010 until now. The first half of the course will look at the causes and the variation of protest and government response. The second half of the class will examine outcomes from multiple angles, including politics, civil war, social change, and international conflict.
